Monkey: Journey to the West

Monkey: Journey to the West began as an opera by Damon Albarn, Jamie Hewlett & Chen Shi-Zheng. It retold the story of the novel Journey to the West, with Damon & Jamie’s own influences; most notably the Japanese show Saiyūki (Monkey!). When shows would be performed, audiences asked if the soundtrack was available to buy, which led to Damon recording studio renditions of his score. However, he decided to rework each song into the style of Gorillaz; making it (in Damon’s words) a Gorillaz album in every aspect apart from the name. The opera ran from 2007 to 2009, with a brief return in 2013.

Music | Videos | Books

MUSIC
Journey to the West

Release date: 18th August 2008

Formats: Digital / CD / 12″ Vinyl

A studio adaptation of the opera’s score, reworking the music as if it was meant to be a Gorillaz album.

Monkey Bee

Release date: 2008

Formats: CD (Promo)

The only single from Journey to the West.

VIDEOS
Monkey Bee (Music Video)
Journey to the East

This short was commissioned by the BBC for their coverage of the Beijing 2008 Olympics; it uses the song Journey to Beijing (TV Theme Song) and went on to win a BAFTA.

BOOKS
Journey to the West Booklet

Release date: 25th August 2008

This features artwork, lyrics, character bios & a plot synopsis for Monkey: Journey to the West. It’s included with Journey to the West (Deluxe Edition).

Journey to the West Artbook

Release date: 8th December 2008

This features art & sketches for Monkey: Journey to the West. It’s included with Journey to the West (Art Edition).
